conclusion: To determine if Object A and Object B have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \), analyze the slopes of their velocity-time curves.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, represented by the slope of the velocity-time graph.
Object A's velocity is represented by the curve labeled 'A'.
Object B's velocity is represented by the curve labeled 'B'.
Locate \( t_1 \) on the horizontal time axis.
For Object A, observe the slope of curve A at \( t_1 \).
If the curve is decreasing, the slope is negative; if increasing, the slope is positive.
For Object B, observe the slope of curve B at \( t_1 \) in the same manner.
Compare the slopes: if equal, accelerations are the same; if different, accelerations are different.
At \( t_1 \), Object A's curve is decreasing, indicating negative acceleration.
Object B's curve is increasing, indicating positive acceleration.
Since the slopes of the curves for Object A and Object B at \( t_1 \) are not the same, the accelerations are not the same.
Final Answer: No, the two objects do not have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \).
